Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World(int rows, int columns)
      The World constructor constructs a new 2D world of size [rows][columns].

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(WorldObject obj, int x, int y)
      The 'add' method attempts to store the given WorldObject at the specified location in the World.
      void display()
      The 'display' method prints to the screen a 2D representation of the world, where at each occupied block, that WorldObject's token is printed.
      WorldObject[][] getMyWorld() 
      boolean isValidIndex(int x, int y)
      Given x,y parameters, the 'isValidIndex' returns true if the 2D index of World[x][y] is valid.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void step()
      The 'step' method advances the simulation of the setup world by one step.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int rows,
             int columns)
        The World constructor constructs a new 2D world of size [rows][columns].
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of rows in the 2D world
        columns - Number of columns in the 2D world

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step()
        The 'step' method advances the simulation of the setup world by one step. That is, each autonomous object can make one step, for which other objects may move because of collisions caused by these moving autonomous objects.

      • getMyWorld

        public WorldObject[][] getMyWorld()

      • display

        public void display()
        The 'display' method prints to the screen a 2D representation of the world, where at each occupied block, that WorldObject's token is printed. To denote an empty block in the world, the ASCII character 'â–‘' is printed.

      • isValidIndex

        public boolean isValidIndex(int x,
                            int y)
        Given x,y parameters, the 'isValidIndex' returns true if the 2D index of World[x][y] is valid.
        Parameters:
        x - Row parameter
        y - Column parameter
        Returns:
        Boolean if World[x][y] is a valid location

      • add

        public void add(WorldObject obj,
                int x,
                int y)
        The 'add' method attempts to store the given WorldObject at the specified location in the World. If the specified location is already occupied by another WorldObject, an error results.
        Parameters:
        obj - The WorldObject to be stored
        x - The specified location's row
        y - The specified location's column

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
